comments.commentBody:
Ah,but those guys you mention at the end of your comment are gifted interviewers and comedians. They make people laugh.
Trolls are dull, boring and unfunny. SAD!

In reply to Psysword:
Somehow, your post made me think of paintings by Hieronymus Bosch.

Clearly, DeVos and Trump have no knowledge, experience, or  expertise in education. They do have knowledge, experience, and expertise in siphoning off tax dollars into their own pockets.   And yes, DeVos has her personal agenda to allow creationism to be taught as if it is a valid scientific explanation of how the earth became what it has become.  It is unlikely that she or Trump have any real knowledge of what evolution is or why it is considered to be proven concept at this time, with a a great deal of evidence to show why that is the case.
Empty Ubers jam shopping center parking lots and bus zones. Ubers with one passenger or just cruising are blocking our downtown streets. In San Francisco too

The man is positively Nixonian in his paranoia now.

Even if he were correct, these early-morning Tweets embolden our foreign enemies and rivals. They can tell that our leader is less than stable, mentally.
Nixon was crazy but not stupid.
The scary part is that who in their right minds would enlist in the Armed Forces with this nut job, er, mentally unbalanced individual, in charge.

Nixon may have been paranoid, but he was knowledgeable and intelligent.  Dear lord, who would ever have thought we'd wind up in a place where our chief executive is so deranged and downright stupid that even Richard Nixon *drunk* would be preferable.

I am not a doctor or play one on TV, but do you think this applies to 45’s accusations of 44? If so, sad! Bigly and hugely sad!

“Paranoid schizophrenia is a subtype of schizophrenia in which the patient has delusions that a person or some individuals are plotting against them or members of their family.”

Or perhaps, early signs of Alzheimer's or dementia. Some individuals in early stages are thoroughly convinced that certain people are "doing them in"
For example, In marriages, husband or wife with early dementia start to accuse the partner of infidelity. As the disease progresses, the bizzare accusations and behavior gets worse.

When people enter the first stages of dementia, they can have this sort of paranoia, in my limited experience. And there is more evidence of this beyond my own limited experience.
http://www.alzfdn.org/EducationandCare/paranoia.html

@EricR
"Trump has publicly accused a citizen of a serious crime for which there is no evidence."
No it isn't. It would be, at most, slander; a civil cause of action, not a criminal one.
When you accuse someone, without a shred of evidence, of being like McCarthy, you're the one who's being like McCarthy.
Of course he thinks of McCarthy!  Twitler's personal lawyer is Roy Cohn who was McCarthy’s aide!
. . . and how many of the original protagonists are still alive when the curtain comes down.
Trump learned the craft well from Roy Cohn, right hand man to Joe McCarthy.
This looks like good grounds for Obama to hit Trump with a defamation lawsuit.  Could be a game-changer.

A lawsuit may also lead to the discovery of Trump's tax returns.  Trump's allegations are slanderous per se, and if Trump was found to be liable for punitive damages his tax returns would be necessary to calculate the appropriate amount of punitive damages.
in order to sue, Obama would have to prove he was materially affected.  Trump's rants do nothing but make Obama look better than ever.
Another distraction. Obama just ignore him.

Exactly right.
And people like Bannon and Mercer should be thoroughly investigated and brought before the courts for treason-like activity and mischief.They are causing substantial harm to the world.

Yet another diversion to keep the focus and the news cycle off The Russian Connection.

That is all it is, folks.
This actually lasers the focus on the Russian scandal MORE. I don't know if he meant to do that, but the fact remains.
"tapp" dancing.

If that was the rational then like a lot of the other things he has done, it's a failure. It's either a baseless lie or if indeed a warrant was issue for a tap it could only have been in relation to the Russian connection.
It's going to be a long winter after all.
Madpat, I'm betting my mother told my father not to take that trail with me.  In fact I have no acrophobia at all, so would probably have loved it.

Psysword

Your paean to transformation of trolls from wispy online demons of the mind to a real world force might seem important if you and the other trolls had managed the transition better.

You can take your good-old-fashioned-and-really-pretty-boring "nothing really matters" glee in the face of the pain and destruction you wreak (and which is, after all, your one reason for being; your only confirmation that something you do or say might matter to somebody) and transfer it to the real world if you like.

But once you're there, you're going to want to eat a little and probably drink a lot of water. In preference to dying, I mean. What you will find, though, is that your airy fairy online mockery of anything anybody cares about, of the simple act of caring about anything, make that food and that water and the system that delivers them problematic.

One clear hope in this regard is your obvious realization of how quickly this ugly moment is passing you by, signaled by your mad plunge into increasingly mean and desperate cries for attention.

You've been co-opted. You're already losing, despite the inability of outlets like the New York Times to control their hunger for your commentary and hate.

Honestly, when a pudgy real estate huckster with no discernible fashion sense takes over your scam, and passes it on to beer swilling pickup drivers around the country, how much longer do you really think its going last?

So long, boys. It's hasn't been all that much fun.
Your right.

Sure we can all ignore the Trolls and hope they just go away. Here's the problem: one of them holds the nuclear launch codes. Not beyond the frat boy mentality to cause harm in real life just for the "LOLZ."
But maybe they know nouns from adjectives? :))))
So much for the praise he received Tuesday night for "acting Presidential".
Pat, that's what it was:  an act!

Breitbart, Breitbart, Breitbart... Mark Levin, Mark Levin, Mark Levin. How far gone are you? And this says nothing about wiretapping. It is mere speculation that something COULD happen. Think for once.

One wonders what "medication" he received before he delivered that address that enabled him to stay focused for an hour or so. Whatever it was is really a wonder drug.  It should be available to all psychiatric patients.

Sure, why not swoon over the president when he shifts gears from a raving maniac into a calm, platitude-spouting crooner? So what if it’s all a fraud? If the people of this country had enough discernment to detect a fraud when they saw one, he wouldn’t have been elected. But on the night he addressed Congress and the nation, standing in front of his insipidly beaming enablers, you could almost hear Burt Parks sing. There he is, Mr. America. There he is, our ideal.

All he needed to do was to read someone else’s words from a teleprompter and to promise things that were beyond his ability to give, like world peace, or affordable health care. Shameless pundits ate it up, showing themselves to be every bit as capable has perpetrating a fraud as the president.

It didn’t last long. Soon after, he accused Mr. Obama of having bugged Trump Tower, a bizarre and possibly insane statement that was designed to shift blame onto the last real president, but which could do nothing but make sensible people cringe at the inane childishness of it all.

There is one thing that separates the deeply flawed and destructive George W. Bush from the latest occupant of the Oval Office. Bush has a sense of humor. The president has none. He can smirk and grimace, but he can’t show a sincere smile, or laugh except in a mocking exaggeration of normal human feeling. He especially cannot laugh at himself.

Fortunately, the rest of us can do that for him.
"Even worse than Trump?"  You have got to be kidding me! Your reality is even more distorted than Richard Luettgen's.

@Mark, you're absolutely right. The corrupt Democrats were so bent on crushing the left wing of THEIR OWN PARTY and installing a deeply flawed, persistently unpopular candidate that they allowed Trump to sneak up on them.

To all of you "Three Million Votes" folks, some humility is in order: Remember that between votes for Trump and for third-party candidates, a clear majority of the electorate said a resounding "no" to Clinton. The goal is to get to 270; not to win California by the widest possible margin. FYI, I am not a Trump supporter.

I agree with most of what you say ,gemli, but I think we all need to avoid stating that the people of the country didn't have "enough discernment to detect a fraud" in the election, for as we all know he actually lost to the "loser" by 2.8 million popular votes across the nation. The nation thus did show plenty of discernment. We need to keep  hammering at the truth that the electoral college enshrined the biggest loser in the history of presidential elections as the winner; that due to the infuriating complexity of its state-by-state rules the electoral college is nothing but a dangerous Rube Goldberg-type contraption not a democratic entity, and it's time to bring in direct elections just as we have for other federal, state and local  representative offices in the country.  Give no quarter to the present Liar-in-Chief whenever he claims a " landslide" victory.

OH!  Those Little Debbies!  I "had" to buy them for my daughter's softball team, which was called the Little Debbies after their coach, as after-school snacks were one of the most important parts of each game or practice.  And there was somehow usually one left for me.
I am a raving liberal, but Evan loves his country and puts country first. I would gladly support him.
And as a Democrat, I would vote for Mr. McMullin, if I thought he could help change the scary course this country is taking under Mr. Trump.

If one is to follow McMullin's reasoning, that is, that there are no real leaders in 'publican party, surely, in response to the question, Why do you think the Republicans aren’t leading an investigation? the last sentence of that reply should read "... the problem now is that we have representatives--not leaders."
If for no other reason, I'm grateful to McMullin for giving my conservative LDS siblings the opportunity to vote for a man who embodies the decency that Trump lacks.

" I just learned yesterday that I am considered part of the “deep state” by the unhinged Alex-Jones-and-Breitbart types."

Being denounced by The Unhinged, especially the poisonous Jones, is like being on Nixon's Enemies List--a badge of honor. Congratulations.

I will not allow my future, the future of my family, my country, its constitution and bill of rights to be held hostage on a question of the past sins commited by my country. We should not beat our chests while saying Mea Culpa and allow someone at least as imperfect as we to destroy our country. That is not making amends. It is suicidal. Point to a time, a country that is free of sin. Someone is trying to destroy the values of this country not because we are perfect but because even with our imperfections we are a threat to them. I was not a US Marine but I appreciate their motto:  Semper Fi!
